column5: So my buddy and i that just started drift fishing last fall got out for the second time this spring on thursday morning.  we started off slow working our way up the creek, about an hour into it i pulled in my first fish of the morning   having yet to land a fish drifting i set him up in the exact spot i just got that one.  not 3 casts later he hooks into and lands his first, Congrats bud!   feeling generous i leave him to the spot and move up stream further. when i hook into this a few minutes later, guess kharma swung my way this time   that was pretty much it for the rest of the morning, had a small brown break my line because i neglected to retie after a snag.  i won't make that mistake again...  not a huge amount of fish but big excitment for us noobs, can't wait to get back on the water  AA.
Any day with fish is a great day, especially trout!   Congrats to you and your friend....nice looking fish!
It is a great feeling to "break the ice" when learning to fish steel. Really nice fish, WTG
Great report and pics alphaalpha  Good looking steel.... congratulations to both of you and thanks for sharing Leechman
